rules.natural: Either the farmer uses pesticide on crops or the farmer does not have a loan with the bank.
In the event that the farmer increases the yield of crops, the farmer is profitable in the season.
Should the farmer reduce the cost of production, then the farmer increases the yield of crops.
If the farmer defaults on the loan, the bank forecloses on the farm.
Given that the farmer defaults on the loan, it is not the case that the bank forecloses on the farm.
If it is not the case that investing in an irrigation system leads to reduced production costs, then the farmer sells land to an investor.
Assuming that investing in an irrigation system does not result in reduced production costs, the farmer does not sell land to an investor.
When the investment in an irrigation system does not make the farmer profitable in the season, the farmer has a loan with the bank.
In cases where investing in an irrigation system fails to yield profitability for the farmer in the season, the farmer defaults on the loan.

facts.natural: The farmer invests in an irrigation system.
It is not the case that the farmer uses pesticide on crops.

target.natural: The farmer is profitable in the season.

steps.natural: The farmer does not have a loan with the bank.

natural_facts.A2: The farmer has a loan with the bank.
natural_facts.A3: The farmer uses pesticide on crops.
natural_facts.A4: The farmer increases the yield of crops.
natural_facts.A5: The farmer reduces the cost of production.
natural_facts.A6: The farmer sells land to an investor.
natural_facts.A7: The farmer defaults on the loan.
natural_facts.A8: The bank forecloses on the farm.
natural_facts.G: The farmer is profitable in the season.

(A1 → A4).natural: If the farmer invests in an irrigation system, then the farmer increases the yield of crops.

(A1 → A5).natural: Provided that the farmer invests in an irrigation system, the farmer reduces the cost of production.

(A1 → G).natural: Whenever the farmer invests in an irrigation system, the farmer is profitable in the season.

(A3 ∨ ¬A2).natural: Either the farmer uses pesticide on crops or the farmer does not have a loan with the bank.

(A4 → G).natural: In the event that the farmer increases the yield of crops, the farmer is profitable in the season.

(A5 → A4).natural: Should the farmer reduce the cost of production, then the farmer increases the yield of crops.

(A7 → A8).natural: If the farmer defaults on the loan, the bank forecloses on the farm.

(A7 → ¬A8).natural: Given that the farmer defaults on the loan, it is not the case that the bank forecloses on the farm.

(¬(A1 → A5) → A6).natural: If it is not the case that investing in an irrigation system leads to reduced production costs, then the farmer sells land to an investor.

(¬(A1 → A5) → ¬A6).natural: Assuming that investing in an irrigation system does not result in reduced production costs, the farmer does not sell land to an investor.

(¬(A1 → G) → A2).natural: When the investment in an irrigation system does not make the farmer profitable in the season, the farmer has a loan with the bank.

(¬(A1 → G) → A7).natural: In cases where investing in an irrigation system fails to yield profitability for the farmer in the season, the farmer defaults on the loan.

A1.natural: The farmer invests in an irrigation system.

G.natural: The farmer is profitable in the season.

¬A2.natural: The farmer does not have a loan with the bank.

¬A3.natural: It is not the case that the farmer uses pesticide on crops.

¬A7.natural: The farmer does not default on the loan.
